snippet.textDisplay:
SSA (Social Security recipients) not required to file Income Tax BUT would only get $1200 per SSA recipient. If household has only one SSA recipient but two adults (other spouse not on SSA), household would only get $1200 because IRS doesn't know about other individual. If it's just you in "household," don't sweat it. If both of you get SSA don't sweat it. If neither of those scenarios fit you, FILE. It's quick, easy, free. ... ... ...FROM WEBSITE -- "Q: I am not typically required to file a tax return. Can I still receive my payment?
A: Yes. The IRS will use the information on the Form SSA-1099 or Form RRB-1099 to generate Economic Impact Payments to recipients of benefits reflected in the Form SSA-1099 or Form RRB-1099 who are not required to file a tax return and did not file a return for 2018 or 2019. This includes senior citizens, Social Security recipients and railroad retirees who are not otherwise required to file a tax return.
...Since the IRS would not have information regarding any dependents for these people, each person would receive $1,200 per person, without the additional amount for any dependents at this time." -- https://www.irs.gov/newsroom/economic-impact-payments-what-you-need-to-know
snippet.textOriginal:

It's quick, easy, free. ... ... ...FROM WEBSITE -- "Q: I am not typically required to file a tax return. Can I still receive my payment?

snippet.textDisplay: IMPORTANT MESSAGE: Okay....so here is a new, specific and accurate update regarding the Treasury Departments change about people receiving "Social Security" not having to take any action to receive their stimulus check, as it applies to SSI, Veterans Affairs, etc. Go to www.cbpp.org and read the article/BLOG by Chuck Marr, dated April 2, 2020 at 3 PM. The "Center on Budget and Policy Priorities" makes it clear in their article (second paragraph) that "Recipients of SSI and Veterans Affairs (VA) pension benefits who don't file returns and don't receive Social Security retirement or disability benefits aren't covered by Treasury's decision yesterday to provide payments automatically to Social Security beneficiaries who don't file." This is what I was worried about because when the Treasury Department came out with that update yesterday they just said Social Security and never mentioned specifics, such as SSI, Veterans Affairs, etc., which is what they would do if it applied to those groups, as they differ in many ways. So at this point it seems that there are people and groups out there that are fighting for those on SSI and the like to have them included in not having to file a return or a "simple return" in order to receive the stimulus check, but right now that decision is in limbo and a decision should be made in the near future to determine what steps, if any, those on SSI and the like may have to take to receive their stimulus check. If you read the entire article you will get the idea that they are still trying to get this worked out and are trying to make it so that those specific people won't have to take any action and will just receive their checks by direct deposit or by mail. I don't really understand what the issue is. The SSA has all of the information for those on SSI, just like those receiving SSDI, and they could just as easily access their information from the SSA to determine qualification and to provide the stimulus checks. I guess we will have to wait a little while to see what they decide to do. I just wanted for everyone under these circumstances to know the truth because so many people have been spreading false and inaccurate information in these posts. Please go to the site and read the entire article. Hopefully this will all get worked out quickly and effectively !
snippet.textOriginal: IMPORTANT MESSAGE: Okay....so here is a new,  specific and accurate update regarding the Treasury Departments change about people receiving "Social Security" not having to take any action to receive their stimulus check, as it applies to SSI, Veterans Affairs, etc. Go to www.cbpp.org and read the article/BLOG by Chuck Marr, dated April 2, 2020 at 3 PM. The "Center on Budget and Policy Priorities" makes it clear in their article (second paragraph) that "Recipients of SSI and Veterans Affairs (VA) pension benefits who don't file returns and don't receive Social Security retirement or disability benefits aren't covered by Treasury's decision yesterday to provide payments automatically to Social Security beneficiaries who don't file." This is what I was worried about because when the Treasury Department came out with that update yesterday they just said Social Security and never mentioned specifics, such as SSI, Veterans Affairs, etc., which is what they would do if it applied to those groups, as they differ in many ways. So at this point it seems that there are people and groups out there that are fighting for those on SSI and the like to have them included in not having to file a return or a "simple return" in order to receive the stimulus check, but right now that decision is in limbo and a decision should be made in the near future to determine what steps, if any, those on SSI and the like may have to take to receive their stimulus check. If you read the entire article you will get the idea that they are still trying to get this worked out and are trying to make it so that those specific people won't have to take any action and will just receive their checks by direct deposit or by mail. I don't really understand what the issue is. The SSA has all of the information for those on SSI, just like those receiving SSDI, and they could just as easily access their information from the SSA to determine qualification and to provide the stimulus checks. I guess we will have to wait a little while to see what they decide to do. I just wanted for everyone under these circumstances to know the truth because so many people have been spreading false and inaccurate information in these posts. Please go to the site and read the entire article. Hopefully this will all get worked out quickly and effectively !

Salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to mankind by which we must be saved. Acts 4:12
Repent and receive Jesus into your heart. Time is short.

snippet.textDisplay:
I filed both 2018 and 2019 tax returns. That being said, the stimulus check(s) will be direct deposited because that's how I directed my refund(s). I'm also on Social Security (Retirement). All I've read about those on Social Security will receive the check, my
Social Security check is also direct deposited so I reasonable believe the Stimulus check will be direct deposited as well. Now, a while back I read that you need not file a tax return to qualify, however, those who did not file, Adults will receive a reduced check of $600. 1) I know thing can AND DO change on a dime 2) In this video, this is the first time I heard about going to any web portal to file for your stimulus check - GREAT CAUTION IS ADVISED HERE - if it were me, I WOULD NOT relinquish any information via this media UNLESS it was a dot gov (.gov) web site and your information is protected. 3). Last but not least - - I know there are many helpful individuals, BUT PLEASE, do not base your actions on ANY so-called instructional youtube video. The scammers are out in full force. Trust me, the IRS and/or the Federal government know exactly who you are. If you believe for some reason you might be missed, YOU contact THEM. Be careful, Be safe, Be well.
snippet.textOriginal:
I filed both 2018 and 2019 tax returns.  That being said, the stimulus check(s) will be direct deposited because that's how I directed my refund(s).  I'm also on Social Security (Retirement).  All I've read about those on Social Security will receive the check, my
 Social Security check is also direct deposited so I reasonable believe the Stimulus check will be direct deposited as well. Now, a while back I read that you need not file a tax return to qualify, however, those who did not file, Adults will receive a reduced check of $600.  1)  I know thing can AND DO change on a dime 2) In this video, this is the first time I heard about going to any web portal to file for your stimulus check - GREAT CAUTION IS ADVISED HERE - if it were me, I WOULD NOT relinquish any information via this media UNLESS it was a dot gov (.gov) web site and your information is protected.  3).  Last but not least - - I know there are many helpful individuals, BUT PLEASE, do not base your actions on ANY so-called instructional youtube video.  The scammers are out in full force.  Trust me, the IRS and/or the Federal government know exactly who you are.  If you believe for some reason you might be missed, YOU contact THEM.  Be careful, Be safe, Be well.

snippet.textDisplay:
Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin Wednesday announced that Social Security recipients would not have to file tax returns in order to receive coronavirus stimulus payments.


The reversal comes after complaints from lawmakers that an IRS plan to require seniors to file simplified returns would place an undue burden on them amid widespread shutdowns and social distancing guidelines implemented in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.

https://www.politico.com/news/2020/04/01/social-security-recipients-coronavirus-stimulus-160757
snippet.textOriginal:
Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin Wednesday announced that Social Security recipients would not have to file tax returns in order to receive coronavirus stimulus payments.


The reversal comes after complaints from lawmakers that an IRS plan to require seniors to file simplified returns would place an undue burden on them amid widespread shutdowns and social distancing guidelines implemented in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.

https://www.politico.com/news/2020/04/01/social-security-recipients-coronavirus-stimulus-160757

I just discovered you recently, and I am on disability, and you've been so incredibly helpful!! I really appreciate that you put this info out there for people, and I wanted to say thank you, thank you, thank you!!

snippet.textDisplay:
So where does all the unclaimed money go; last time I was in the United States people where iffy about during their taxes, at best.
Your government is a joke. They get their money on the front end and back. You pay into the economy rather you pay taxes or not; you're a consumer, you dig? Why are their stipulations on your money should be the question? Lots won't qualify by default.
You people are kidding yourselves. You sign a $2 trillion relief stimulus packet. Do you know that if you gave each citizen of the US a $1 million there would still be plenty. Descendants of slave talk reparations; they could give them an extra million and there would still be plenty.
Do you people have any idea how much $2 trillion is???
Funny how most of your government officials have ties to companies receiving bail out funds. They're giving you scraps and there's stipulations on that.
What is this really about???
Just remember, your president's administration was prepared for the Coronavirus. It's unexcusable!!!
